Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel; good price; good breakfast; a long walk to waterfront”
Reviews.Author: craigxj
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. Used rewards for two nights but rates were reasonable nonetheless. Breakfast was good deal especially if you have kids - hot items with meat! no self park so need to valet at about $20 per day. Rooms were dated.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Marriott property”
Reviews.Author: bhasi g
Reviews.Content: If you are looking a good nights sleep forget it, the hotel is right next to the freeway and sleep is hard to come by if you get a room with window facing the freeway. It is ridiculous that the room had broken curtain, there was noway to darken the room. I am a fan of Marriott property but this property left me disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Respectable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnitaH4300
Reviews.Content: Although not central it is the same distance to both the Needle and Westlake Center from the hotel. They are both in walking distance but if you aren't inclined than the hotel offers a shuttle service every hour to these two attractions plus the Convention Centre. The room wasn't particular modern but it was very clean, spacious and homely. There was a small kitchenette with a microwave, a desk and couch/tv area. Very comfortable. The staff were excellent. Well informed and friendly. The biggest let down was the breakfast. There was no real food. The eggs were powered, the waffles tasted of bitter chemicals from the spray you needed to use on the waffle maker. No real milk and powered tang instead of orange juice. The apples were rotten on the inside even though they looked perfect on the outside. The bananas were under ripe and crunchy even though again they were perfect on the outside. Go to Wholefoods instead for your meals which is on the way back to Westlake Center. The cheapest way to and from the airport is definitely the train. It's only $2.50 per person to Westlake Center. From there a taxi is only $5-6 or a 5-7 min walk. After checking out book the free shuttle to take you back to Westlake Center train station.

Reviews.Title: “a good option”
Reviews.Author: you_gotta_be_here
Reviews.Content: Staff: Very knowledgable about the area and offered great suggestions for where the locals go. Rooms: Definitely not fancy and a little dated but it was clean and comfortable. Breakfast: A good mix of hot and cold options for the buffet breakfast (eggs, sausauges, cereal, pastries etc. and even a waffle maker) -- but don't wait until the end of the breakfast run since some of the food options aren't replenished anymore. Location: It's not right in the heart of the city but it's only a short walk or cab ride into shopping/dining/nightlife core, belltown and the wharf. But if you're wanting to step outside and be in the thick of things, then the location may not be the best since there isn't much around it (take a look at the street view from googlemaps). And although it's next to the highway, the noise wasn`t bad since we were facing the quiet side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice downtown”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is a half mile to downtown. And get a room facing away from the freeway. Great breakfast. 2 free computers. Free use of the 24 Hour Fitness across the street. A short walk up the hill to Capitol Hill with many restaurant and bar choices. Free shuttle to downtown area. Have stayed their many times with no complaints. (I enjoy the CBC Canadian channel on the TV). Did I mention the friendly staff?

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley M
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Springhill Suites in Seattle. I was in town from Fort Mohave, Arizona, visiting a friend. We stayed here, because it was basically in the middle of everything we were doing in 2 days. The staff was super friendly, the room was perfect, breakfast in the morning was great, and the shuttle service to the Space Needle was a nice plus. We got checked in by 11 am, which was great, because we had a day full of activities planned, and it was nice to get our stuff put away so we could enjoy ourselves. The price was very reasonable as well. I totally recommend staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and irresponsible.”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: This place is a mess. Check out the picture of the TV remote that I posted on Yelp. It is crusted with dirt and food....If they don't even bother to clean the obvious crust off of the remote, think about what else they don't clean properly. The heat did not work all night. They missed our wake up call almost making us late for our flight. I have been a Marriott Rewards member for years, I am appalled at this place. When I spoke with the front end supervisor about these issues, he seemed really uninterested and tried throwing 5000 points at me to make me go away. I gave him the remote and asked him if he saw a problem with it, his response, "ummm, what's wrong, oh, do you mean that it is a little dirty?" Bottom line, I stayed at this place 4 years ago and it was nice. Since then, it has slipped. It is close to the freeway, but quite a ways from anything else that you would want to do downtown. Don't stay here, find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean & friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Dale D
Reviews.Content: Did the Clipper combination from Victoria. Very impressed with how clean & friendly the staff were. The free shuttles were handy & very convenient to use. Free breakfast was ok but no meat. Didn't do dinner but had appies & drinks.. Don't try the sliders. Really to far to walk anywhere so thats why the free shuttle I guess. Pool & hot tub looked good but no change room!. To many kids so didn't use. Very well run outfit. Get the higher floors . The roar on the second floor was a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for quick stay”
Reviews.Author: 2141Travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this weekend for a visit to Seattle - the hotel was ok -small rooms need remodeling- some mold present in shower area- nice staff and free shuttle to Westlake Ctr and the Space Needle- the lobby and breakfast were good. Hotel was not as nice as other Springhill suites we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Good business-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuySTL
Reviews.Content: We found this to be an adequate hotel for one night in Seattle. It was an easy walk to downtown and the Pike Place activity. The hotel was clean and comfortable and the front desk staff did an outstanding job for me in arranging transportation to the train station and mailing a camera I had left behind in the room (and a hat and gloves also left behind...) We found some outstanding restaurants within walking distance and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay at a Marriott Property”
Reviews.Author: gottman
Reviews.Content: Great Breakfast!!!! Close to everything (3-4 Blocks to free bus zone), Room was adequate. Hot tub felt good after a day of walking. Make sure to ask about the shuttle and where it goes... We didn't find out until departure

Reviews.Title: “OK but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: yyjguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly met the standards for a hotel such as this. However, I was disappointed in the jacuzzi as there was no air in the jets, just hotish water squirting out! The breakfast was quite poor for a hotel such as this, paper plates and plastic utensils. There was noise transmission between suites; conversations and TV clearly heard. I also found the location somewhat out of the way, a 10-15 minute walk to the shopping area, although they do provide a shuttle once an hour. Unlike other reviews, I heard no noise from the freeway even though my room faced that way. Staff excellent, and very clean property. The Homewood Suites is much closer and a similar style property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: wormboy13
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about this hotel being so far from downtown, but it was in a great location. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the Westlake Center and 20 minutes to Pikes Places. It was also located to Capital Hill which has some great little restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A Marriott is still a Marriott..”
Reviews.Author: agbowden
Reviews.Content: Took awards points to do a college visit for my son - and found this to be the best deal in Seattle. The staff was wonderful - truly trained the Marriott way - and the hotel was clean, and had a great buffet breakfast included. However, this is at the bottom of the Marriott hierarchy. The room on the top floor was plenty spacious, had microwave, coffee maker, and small refridge - and was clean. However, I never stayed in a hotel with see through sheets - really, you could see the tag on the mattress pad - actually, you could read the writing on the mattress pad tag through the sheets! The towels smelled of bleach - but were clean. So at the end of the day - I would stay here again - the friendliness of the staff made up for the lack of luxury. A Marriott is still a Marriott - and you can trust the quality. They served the best clam chowder we had this trip! Somewhat out of the way - but not awful - and the $20 valet parking was relatively reasonable for Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel + but getting due for room renovations”
Reviews.Author: flipper95
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times, and would consider going back. Its a very well priced slightly off downtown option for those visiting the area and want to stay close but save a few dollars. Its a busy hotel, catering towards large groups, tours, and you'll get full common areas and elevators as a result. The area isnt anything too special, its near the REI (a good place to spend money on outdoors stuff), there is a great gym across the street you can use for free (24 hour fitness). The hotel offers breakfast which can be jam packed with people and kids, but it has better than average selections (hot and cold plates). The lobby is very recently updated, well done. The rooms are beginning to show their age and the lighting is a bit low. The bed was fine, I felt the sheets were a bit on the cheap side. Everything was clean and as I expected. If your expecting a full service hotel in downtown, this hotel is a compromise. The area is a bit off to the side and can be noisy due to the proximity to I5 and the ramps to it. You'll also have about a ten minute walk (often wet being that its Seattle) to the heart of the city and the underground tunnel to the airport light rail.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spacious, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Ben C
Reviews.Content: Despite offering a shuttle bus to major attractions, I found everywhere I wanted to visit in Seattle could be easily reached by walking - which gave me far more flexibility. The staff at reception were great, and handled or problems with good humour. The room itself was spacious, and comfortable, with all the facilities we needed. There was nothing else I could have asked for! Overall, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but questionable customer service”
Reviews.Author: beninbrighton
Reviews.Content: Liked this hotel, bit noisy location near the freeway. Liked the use of good gym and pool opposite. However, we left a ring in the room, and had a lot of trouble contacting the hotel and getting anyone to help us. Still haven't had the problem resolved so quite unsatisfied with the customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price!”
Reviews.Author: LaCoqui222
Reviews.Content: So....if you want upscale in downtown Seattle, expect to pay the price. This is nice, clean Hotel with reasonable prices. We were out and about most of the day, so it met our needs as far as sleeping & eating. One thing I do have to say is that I think this is the wrong picture of the Hotel. SpringHill is in the middle of the block and you have to know exactly where it is. It doesn't stand out like in the photo. Hotel offer a complimentary shuttle to go to Space Needle, Convention Center and one of the Malls. It was a great plus for us! One night the shuttle did forget us, but we took a cab back and the front desk had no problem reimbursing us for the cab fare. Hot breakfast in the morning which was always busy, but everything was well stocked for us. Front desk is extremely helpful. Anything we needed, we just had to ask. Not much around the Hotel to tour, (subway across the street). Not a bad neighborhood....I think the Hotel does their best to control the homeless around the area. Saw more homeless the closer we got to the downtown area. Again, for the price, you cannot go wrong. If you want **** star, then expect to pay the price!

Reviews.Title: “An Okay Choice”
Reviews.Author: DavenGVAR
Reviews.Content: Room - I had a king suite and it was waaaaaay smaller than it looked on the Marriott SpringHill Suites website. So right away my expectations were not met. I was expecting something sleek and comfortable to host me and my 3 travel companions. The pull-out couch could not hold more than 1 person like it claimed unless both people were small children. The bathroom and couch area were pretty darn small too. The room was clean, but it also seemed kind of old. Amenities - The breakfast was tasty and had lots of options, though it could have used with more carb alternatives - not everyone wants to start their day with a big spike to their blood sugar. The shuttle was limited to 3 drop-off points, all fairly close to the hotel anyway, and departed the hotel only once per hour. Location - It's kind of secluded and doesn't feel too safe. If you stay here, be prepared to walk, walk, walk because the hotel is not adjacent to any attractions. The front desk does conveniently provide maps of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: mtngal33
Reviews.Content: My son, mom and I stayed here for two nights prior to a cruise and it served our needs. A broken pack n play was quickly replaced the first night we were there. My son loved the breakfast buffet and all of our needs were met including an inexpensive shuttle down to the pier. Close to the rental car return as well.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Checkbook
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property in early September and was very happy with the hotel and staff. I was attending a conference at the Convention Center and this was walking distance, but at a much better price than the hotels right next to the Convention Center. The hotel and staff were both excellent, especially for the price. I walked to the Space Needle and many restaurants and bars in the area. A bonus is that the REI flagship store is literally right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: annberg1969
Reviews.Content: Planned a 9 day trip from Seattle to SFO. I booked this hotel for our 1st night due to location and also that I needed to utilize a free Marriott catagory 4 room night before expiration. After arriving after midnight at the airport and waiting for an eternity for the local shuttle that I booked in advance.What a pleasant surprise, wonderful service from beginning to end. The rooms were quiet, beds were comfortable, complimentary breakfast was excellent...everything was done right. The entire stay was smooth, shuttle service to Pikes Place Market, car rental agencies near by, the friendliest service, wishing every hotel could make it look this simple! This hotel could teach some catagory 6 hotels a thing or two!

Reviews.Title: “Further out but a very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: handpickd
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for it's location close to a relative's apartment, not as a downtown hotel. We arrived about 1:00 pm and had requested an early check in. The room was available for us. If travelling with others and wanting a suite, I will warn you that there were no doors to close off the bedroom or the sink/vanity area of the bathroom. The shower/toilet area has a door but is small, so its is not a good set up if you need privacy. The staff was very friendly. Grab the business card for the shuttle when you check in. We had no problems when we called about 30 minutes beforehand but other people who just showed up found the shuttle to be full. The breakfast was the typical set up and runs for a fairly short time span so it was very busy, lines for the waffle maker as noted. I also liked having the business center available since I was traveling without a laptop but it did seem to typically have people waiting to use the two computers. We did walk from my relatives place back to the hotel late at night. Twice we (2 women) had homeless people asking for money but didn't feel unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: SunniK
Reviews.Content: The location was great. We came in for a cruise and requested (and received) a higher floor with a gorgeous view of the space needle. The hotel also has a great system for storing your luggage until you depart for your cruise. They have everything you need, including a great hot breakfast. The staff and room were great!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly, good for business too”
Reviews.Author: MissWisc
Reviews.Content: Big room with fridge and microwave, wonderful for things from Pike's Place Market. King size bed and couch that folds out for the kids. Small, but nice pool, hot-tub and exercise room. Hotel's free shuttle service runs to the Sephora about 3 blocks from Pikes Place Market at the top of each hour and to the Space Needle at the bottom of the hour. The desk staff were WONDERFUL in answering questions, recommeding late-night places to eat (13 Coins and Milano's delivery) and helping us meet our every need. There's a small grocery store a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not very convenient for downtown/attractions”
Reviews.Author: RHess81
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location...That's the only reason I haven't rated the SpringHill a four. The hotel itself was great, and everything you'd expect from a business property. The free internet and business center were really useful, and the staff were friendly and very helpful, helping me organize taxis and answering general questions about the area. The free breakfast, though very crowded, was really good, with lots of choices. Though I didn't have time to make use of the pool and jacuzzi, I wish I did, because they looked very nice. The rooms were spacious and clean (no great views here, though) , and well furnished. The only downside to this nice hotel was its proximity to downtown. I was in Seattle for a conference at the convention center, and it was just a bit too far to walk with my heavy laptop bag. I ended up springing for a taxi most days Similarly, the downtown area was walking distance, but quite a far walk. The hourly shuttles to the Westlake Center and Space Needle were a good option, but you had to reserve in advance, and they only run until 9:30, which doesn't quite work if you're out and about in the city. And there's only the one stop, so depending on where you're coming from, you may have to walk a few long blocks to meet the shuttle. The hotel was close to the highway, so if you had your own car, or a rental, I suppose it would have been convenient for travel by car. The taxi to the airport was quite pricy, $50 including tip, whereas I think there's a much lower flat fee from the heart of downtown. All in all, I was happy with my choice, but if and when I return to Seattle, I would probably opt for something closer to the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced Option Near Tourist Attractions”
Reviews.Author: Creekview_al
Reviews.Content: Well maintained older property near the Seattle Center. Provides complimentary shuttle service to Space Needle and other points. Very cooperative staff. Nice choices on breakfast buffet. Immediate neighborhood in transition and not overly attractive, but lots of ethnic food choices for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tmoney1982
Reviews.Content: The rooms were fairly large and clean, the wireless worked great, and the breakfast was pretty good for being free. The front desk attendants were also very kind and helpful. I would definitely consider staying here next time I travel to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, good amenities, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: SueinNZ
Reviews.Content: Once I'd hiked/ bussed up from the harbour to the hotel, wondred why I'd chosen such an out of the way location. The Denny triangle is a marketing myth and something of a trek to the places you want to visit- as well as being an area with a large number of homeless people at certain times of the day. That said, the hotel was more than satisfactory. The bedroom/ living area with microwave and bathroom were all well-appointed and there was a good supply of tea/ coffee in the room. Even better, a good breakfast was served every morning downstairs and there was none-stop tea and coffee making in the lobby. Added to this, there were two free computer terminals in the lobby for internet access. Service was pleasant at all times. If you had a family in the room, and/ or arrived with a car to get about in it would be really very good value indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended and you can be proud of it”
Reviews.Author: vi70
Reviews.Content: Don't miss their breakfast Walk to town and browse around the market place and walk leisurely in the waterfront. Take the shuttle to go to the Light Train station if you want to go to the airport Don't take a cab from the airport to the hotel, instead take the Light Train to Westlake station and take a cab from there ($50 vs. $10).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs a bit more TLC”
Reviews.Author: Air747
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. The hotel is okay, but I can't say great. Hotel lobby is nice and clean and kind of feel new. However, this same type of feeling did not carry over to the room. The room overall is good and clean, but a lot of little details are not there. For example, in the bathroom, some corners and few spot of ceiling has some black spots. The couch sank when you are sitting down. Towels had its better day in the past as they are very thin. The wireless Internet at night is impossible to use and very very slow, but during the day it seems okay. The hotel offers shuttle services to down town area, but we did not reserve ahead of time, so no more space for return service. So we ended walk back to the hotel from downtown (around 5th and pine street). It took about 15 minutes walk which is okay with us. Overall, I have no major problem with this hotel, just feel this hotel lacks of attention to the details and if this trend continues, the condition of this hotel can be pretty bad. I will definitely look around and check out other options first.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PDXHelmut
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Springhill Suites downtown Seattle. Everything was up to "Marriott standard" with comfortable beds, spacious suite, nice flat screen TV and free breakfast. The only drawback was that the hotel is a bit of a distance from the waterfront and Pike's market, so there is some walking to do, unless you are driving. The valet parking fee is $21 for 24hrs at this hotel with in-and-out privileges. We would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay-good location-nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: Miviva
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was pleasant, helpful and accommodating when we requested a room change. The suite setup was perfect for us and the location was good, too. We did ask for room on quieter Yale side. Only complaint is a lack of attention to detailed cleaning-the curtains in our room were dirty when we came in.

Reviews.Title: “Excelente service, average breakfast, good location”
Reviews.Author: rommelgu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend in late April and enjoyed Seattle following most of the tips found in Trip Advisor, we were lucky to enjoy a whole sunny Saturday, i'm told that's not very common in Seattle. The hotel is near two of the must see attractions in the city, Pike Place market and the Space Needle, we walked to the Market and all around downtown at nights from the hotel. The next day we took our car to visit other attractions, but as long as you donÂ´t leave downtown, it's not necessary to use a car. Breakfast is average good, and overall service is great. We had a little water filtration problem in our room and the Hotel Manager personally set us up in another room very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on ede of downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: davidbViennaVA
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 2 nice days at this hotel in late June. The rooms were pretty large and having a sofa bed was helpful. We enjoyed the breakfast, which includes both hot and cold items, and in great quantities. We parked on the street over night to avoid the $20 overnight parking fee, My wife and daughter used the fitness center across the street that hotel guest can use and enjoyed it. Nice front desk staff and interesting lobby area with a full bar (not typical for Springhill Suites). Although hotel is near I-5 we did not hear the highway traffic at all.

Reviews.Title: “Decent. Good Sleep. Good value for location”
Reviews.Author: NebraskaJack
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of Marriott, and this hotel did not disappoint. Good breakfast, excellent staff. Good value for the location as other, similar hotels can be up to twice as much.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: SimesFam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after our cruise with two other families. They took care to provide us with shuttle service even after their shuttle van broke down. Were very helpful with storing our 20+ bags both before check-in and after check-out. We ate at their restaurant and were pleasantly surprised by how good the food was! Breakfast was also very delicious. Very good value. Thanks to Ana and Kara for your help with making our stay so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and economical”
Reviews.Author: czbozo
Reviews.Content: The rate was a great value for a hotel near downtown Seattle. Our room was clean and all appliances and lights were in working order. They had a decent daily breakfast. The hotel offered guests complimentary use of the 24-Hour Fitness club across the street. The hotel is within walking distance of Seattle's downtown attractions a big bonus. Many of the hotel's staff were accommodating and friendly. The manager on duty fulfilled our requests but it wouldn't hurt him to smile a little. I would return to the Springhill Suites on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: bwoodTN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before a cruise to Alaska and was happy with the hotel. The rooms are a little dated, but the lobby and service are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel great staff”
Reviews.Author: yasmas
Reviews.Content: This is a real nice Spring Hill Suites. The front counter staff is very well trained; I left some suite cases here for a week as I was traveling around Washington when asked the front counter staff if I could do this â€œAbsolutelyâ€� I said they are kind of large â€œnot a problemâ€�. The next morning when I went to leave them I explained to the lady the gentleman said I could leave them and sheâ€™s like â€œof courseâ€� no one said let me get the manager let me see etc. etc. just an empowered staff to satisfy guests. I also had problem with the HVAC system upon check in they sent maintenance up within 10min could not correct the problem he apologized for the inconvenience and that I needed to go back down to the front desk to switch rooms, again front counter staff apologizing and the gentleman looked hard for the closest room on the same floor and finds one two doors down. As for other things the bar is good, great prices for hotel bar and do not remember ever seeing one in a Spring Hill Suites, breakfast is a little above average for this grade of hotel. Rooms for Spring Hill are on par and about what you would expect. Location is good depending where youâ€™re walking if you donâ€™t mind walking an extra 4-5 blocks from where immediate downtown hotels are to places like Pikes Place it is fine it is also a lot closer to what I think they call the area capitol hill again you need to be ok with walking since you walk up a big hill about three blocks and youâ€™re in a great area with many restaurants and bars and no tourists. You also get free use of 24hr. fitness across the street and internet. I did not have a car but think they charge for parking so just beware to calculate that in your budget. Would stay again when in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyboy55
Reviews.Content: Myself and 4 friends stayed here for a weekend and had a great experience at this hotel. The lobby area has been renovated nicely. The rooms are decent size, we comfortably fit all 5 of us in the 2 beds and pullout. The free use of the 24hr Fitness across the street and the complimentary breakfast were nice additions to a great room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Still good value after all these years”
Reviews.Author: elyette
Reviews.Content: I keep returning to this hotel and after all these years it has not lost its value. The service remains excellent. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The facility is not allowed to deteriorate. Staff continue to treat guests with kind competence. They take pride in their work. The free breakfast cotninues to be a value as well. It took staff 10 minutes to get my room cleaned, but they bent over backwards with me and all other guests in this situation even though we all arrived at 3PM on the dot: free treats at the market, room upgrades. I was not expecting this after a recent stay at the Pan Pacific which touts itself as the epitome of customer service (NOT) and at a famous Chicago hotel whose staff were annoyed at guest requests. Not so, this staff! What a difference! The hotel is in a quiter part of downtown. It was a little over a mile from the theatres in lower Queene Anne (Seattle Center), I was able to walk it. The only down side is the expense of overnight parking which most downtown hotels have anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic breakfast, beautiful lobby”
Reviews.Author: Fire-Fly87
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after a 5 week jaunt around Europe. I flew in to the Seatac airport and decided that it would be fun to stay in Seattle for a night before going home. This hotel was really cozy, I really loved it. The staff was really friendly. The only thing that sucked was the parking, but what else can you expect from a downtown hotel? The breakfast was amazing! The make your own waffle station was the best! There was so much to choose from, I couldn't believe it! The free shuttle to major attractions was also a plus! I'm actually in the process of booking it for the end of the month! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “If you are into Fitness, this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: Marius40
Reviews.Content: When you spend as much time on the road as I do, finding a good hotel with an affiliation with a health club is tops on my list. This establishment is directly across the street from a higher end 24 Hour Fitness (Sport). Use of this facility is complimentary for Marriott Guests. As for other advantages of this hotel, good free breakfast, eggs, oatmeal etc, free high speed internet, and a refrigerator, microwave and sitting area are all pluses. The $20 valet only parking can be defeated by parking in multiple lots including next door for $5.00 after five p.m. or a couple of blocks away (away from the freeway and downtown) for free (read the signs). Taxi to PIke's Market is $6.00 each way and takes less than seven minutes. The entire staff was very nice and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great front desk people”
Reviews.Author: AZSkyKing
Reviews.Content: Everything was great - just wish it was closer to Pike Place. The hotel provides a free shuttle to within about 3 blocks of Pike Place though. One thing I didn't like was the parking, even though it is easy. You have to give your car to an attendant each time you go in/out. It's $20 each day to park your car. I guess there isn't any other option being downtown. I am spoiled by other hotels where you can just park for free.

Reviews.Title: “FINE HOTEL, FAIR LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: The Springhill is a solid 3 star Marriott property. Nothing fancy about it - clean, basic rooms with good beds and a comfortable living room/kitchen area. The neighborhood is dull (the hotel is next to a freeway entrance, you have to walk a ways to get anywhere decent) and $25 for valet parking is a bite, but a complimentary breakfast and free wifi more than make up for it. We got a room with two beds for $99 plus tax - it's hard to get a decent room at this price in any city!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel close to siteseeing”
Reviews.Author: gcbblev
Reviews.Content: This hotel was comfortable with an excellent breakfast included. Showing signs of wear. Located within walking distance of most downtown sites.

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs - and Marriott quality”
Reviews.Author: bclew
Reviews.Content: This was a Marriott reward exchange for a ladies' getaway for a week. (Sat to Sat). One of the gals was attending a conference for the first 3 days and used the free shuttle service to and from the Convention Center. The location is not in the central downtown area - as others have commented. We did not find it a problem for the first few days - using the free shuttle service or walking to the free underground bus station. We picked up a rental car on Wed (to drive to Mt St Helens & Tacoma) and found it very convenient to hop on I-5 to make these trips. The staff was friendly and helpful; rooms and hallways were clean; lobby area very welcoming with nice bar and seating area; complimentary breakfast offered a nice variety - all in all, it was a very nice place for our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--Would Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: GardenState1
Reviews.Content: Stayed with spouse and adult son in king room with sofa bed on 8th floor. Traffic noise was not a problem and room was quiet. Everything was extremely clean! Breakfast was good, fresh & hot (waffles, eggs, sausage, potatoes, fruit, yogurt, toast, bagels, etc.). Coffee/tea in lobby at all times. Shuttle was convenient (3 stops: Westlake Center, Convention Center, and Seattle Center) with both dropoff and pickup by reservation. You could also call desk from stops and request next available pickup. We were able to walk most everywhere within 20 minutes when not taking the shuttle. There was some exercise equipment in a room next to the pool; however, the hotel also offered complimentary membership to a 24/7 gym located directly across the street with a vast amount of equipment. Used free Internet hookup in room with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: Kimberley_inWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful with a spacious lobby and lovely rooms, but it is too far from downtown to be convenient for guests without a car. To make up for it, the hotel provides hourly shuttles to the Space Needle and to Westlake Shopping Center (downtown). We took advantage of the shuttle several times and found the drivers to be very pleasant, but we felt rather confined by our inability to walk anywhere of interest. The hotel has a swimming pool and hot tub. They were pretty typical of hotel poolsâ€”nothing specialâ€”but my family enjoyed them. A free breakfast buffet was also provided. The food selection seemed about average for hotels offering free breakfasts; we were disappointed that at a time when Seattle was full of fresh local fruit (cherries, strawberries, etc.), none of it showed up at breakfast. Instead the usual imported oranges and apples were offered. We had a very nice hotel room with fridge. I particularly liked the way the bathtub/shower and toilet were enclosed in a separate room from the bathroom sink. I stayed at the hotel with my husband and seven-year-old daughter and this bathroom arrangement made brushing teeth and bedtime routines quicker and more convenient. We were however, disappointed that while recycling and compost bins were available in the restaurant (where breakfast was served), they were not provided in our hotel room. Children seemed very welcome in this hotel. When we checked in, the person at the front desk gave my daughter a small toy and activity book. We liked the hotel, but we tend to do a lot of walking and found that the location was a problem for us. We probably won't be back, but it could be a good choice for people who don't want to have to drive half way across the city to get to downtown, but don't expect to be able to walk anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “really great value and location”
Reviews.Author: docfamily164
Reviews.Content: stayed with 2 kids 10 & 12 used as base for Seattle and trip to Forks for twilight tour. Good sized rooms, very clean and comfortable. good location, fantastic breakfast included in price. buffet style with fresh pastries etc and waffle maker which the kids loved. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: yam1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel's title includes downtown. It is about 30 minutes walk to Pier 66, from where boats go to Canada, about 10 minutes to Space Needle and about 20 minutes to Pike Market. So, very good location in that sence. However, the surrounding area is a business type location, so it does not look very attractive at night. I did not walk outside past 7pm, day time and mornings were fine though. The hotel has shuttle that takes you to Space Needel, West Lake shopping mall (4 block from there to Pike Market) and to conference center. All driving times are 5 minutes, if not less. Comfortable rooms, very very spacious. Small bathrooms though, but the sink and mirror were outside of the bathroom, so it was ok. Big screen TV. excellent AC unit, easy to use (unlike in many hotels) and really really QUITE! I have never stayed in a hotel with such a quite AC unit. My room did face the freeway, you do hear the noise but it is somewhat muffled so it did not bother me at all. I am not sure if anyone stayed in adjecent rooms, but i heard nothing at all during the entire stay (4 nights) good breakfast included in room rate, the variety stays the same, but I would not complain since there was not additional charge. There is also coffee/tea service in the lobby all day. The hotel has a bar that serves food, it was good and the pricing was nice. Bathroom amenities are of good quality. The indoor pool is really small, i would compare it with the pool for kids accompanied by adult. The water seemed somewhat chilly to me during the stay, although it was heated to 81 degrees according to thermometer. Complimentary business center, did not use internet in room, so cant write about connection speed etc... front desk is friendly, knowledgebale, very helpful; so are shuttle drivers. The hotel has umbrellas, so you can get one from bell stand if you forgot yours. parking is expensive, right next door is an open parking for a free less then hotel; however based on the non-attractiveness of the surronding area I would park with the hotel, just to be safe, even if its going to be just a few more extra $$

Reviews.Title: “Not good for five people!”
Reviews.Author: GGEly
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent shuttle service Better than average breakfas Good pool Free internet access Cons: No sink in toilet area, it is outisde the sjower/toilet room Not enough towel bars/hooks & no mirror in shower area Grab bar in tub at end next to toilet - unusable for stabilising to step out of tub When sofa bed is opened others in room cannot access the exit door!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best value for a true 3-1/2 star central Seattle hotel”
Reviews.Author: camelSP
Reviews.Content: We stayed the end of May and again in June. May was a great value--AAA rate was $118/night. June was $134, but for a hotel of this type, there was no better deal out there. If you don't mind walking a quarter-mile, it's a great location because you can use the free tunnel bus to get around. Or, when not free, all buses are $2. Rooms are very spacious. There are many more healthy choices for the free breakfast than for most places, including real oatmeal. Internet was great. Room was a very spacious suite. Bed was very comfortable. Ask for a room on the Southwest side and it will be quieter and you'll have a view of the Space Needle. They give you free membership at the 24-hour fitness across the street so I took a fun aerobics class. We took Amtrak, so I don't know about parking, but it's right off Interstate 5.

Reviews.Title: “avoid”
Reviews.Author: sligeachman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a couple of blocks from downtown in an area frequented by deadbeats and of all kinds. We found it impossible to sit outside the hotel without being accosted by these people. Also my wife and I had a frightening experience walking back to the hotel from a nearby restaurant, we were followed and threatened on an empty street by two of these types and were lucky not to be assaulted. The hotel itself had well appointed quite large rooms. However the breakfast was a great dissapointment being more like a cheap motel ( poor food, plastic cutlery, paper plates etc) . We found the staff to be unfriendly and unhelpful. I could not recommend this hotel. Avoid !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff but unfortunately too close to the highway (noisy)!”
Reviews.Author: xmasangel
Reviews.Content: The staff and shuttle service downtown were great. Unfortunately, when you don't get a good night's sleep due to highway noise nothing can make up for it. Good breakfast included. Pricey for lack of sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: designgrl9
Reviews.Content: My young son (under 3) and I tagged along with my husband on a business trip and this was the hotel his work had booked. I had originally wanted to stay closer to downtown, but thought that I could walk everywhere (you are less than a mile to the Space Needle). What I did not take into account was the elevation. There are some serious hills in Seattle! Luckily, the hotel has an EXCELLENT shuttle service that will take you to the three major areas of downtown, the convention center, westlake plaza (near Pike Place Market), and the Seattle Center (where museums and Space Needle are) for FREE!!!! This was a life-saver. Taxi cabs are about $10 from any of those places back to the hotel. The breakfast was sub-par, it got old after awhile, but I don't really expect much out of a free breakfast. The staff was friendly and accommodating. My biggest issue would be there are very few restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Central Town Location With Many Amenities”
Reviews.Author: mike110742
Reviews.Content: This review combines two stays, a year apart, because TripAdvisor does not allow more than one post. Most of my reviews are preceded by counsel for third-party (e.g. Priceline) guests. That counsel has been omitted here. APRIL 2010 PLUS: Room refrigerator had been preset at a reasonable level. Hot water ran quickly. Large, very spacious room with separate living and sleeping sections. Separate bath and vanity area. MINUS: heat and cool control easy to find on wall, but with print on controls so tiny it is barely legible. A wall sign would help. System works well but is very slow to respond. Very centrally located; hourly shuttle and nearly public transportation makes moving about easy. Suggestion: tip the shuttle drivers; they can be very helpful. Avoid a car--and if you have guests, use inexpensive self-pay lot next door or street parking--street free after 6 and on weekends, as all over Seattle. Breakfast space becomes a kitchen for lunch and dinner, but there were so few customers that it can be difficult to get attention. Front desk interaction is necessary for small purchases and is always busy with counseling about how-to-get-where. Polite but can involve long, long waits. Help yourself when possible. APRIL 2009 PLUS: Breakfast buffet: hot eggs and meats, yogurts in two sizes and including low-carb, breads, muffins, make-own waffles, hard eggs, potatoes, hot oatmeal and toppings, cold cereals and juices; excellent coffee/tea in breakfast room and lobby (24 hours). Totally non-smoking, like all Marriotts. Open business center with two-computers and a printer for each, off lobby. Flawless free wired and wireless internet in rooms, wireless in lobby. Newspaper outside door on weekdays, in lobby on weekends. Inside pool and hot tub. Free access to huge 24-hour fitness across the street. Starbucks (closed weekends) across the street. Walk to midtown or downtown or Pike Market; hotel provides by-reservation shuttle on the hour with stops at Westlake Center, Space Needle, Convention Center. The giant, rally giant flagship REI and upscale shops (and BLIX, probably one of Seattleâ€™s best spa spaces) one block walk. Public transportation on Denny (#8 bus) runs between Cap Hill and Queen Anne, past Seattle Center. Valet parking only, with modest rates for short-term visitors, $20 overnight. Recent (fabulous) lobby, breakfast room and bar renovation. Exceptionally helpful and friendly employees. Quiet despite extreme proximity to freeway. Coin laundry with several machines for guests, 2nd floor; $1 each wash and dry when I was there. Priceline 2.5 or 3-star, South Lake Union, $65-72 in winter/spring (desk was quoting $109 to walk-ins one day of my stay); higher in summer/fall. Hotel is owned by a TX company but Marriott-branded; in most of these hotels, Marriott provides management training and staff is well-trained. MINUS: Constant traffic on Yale Avenue can make vehicle exit risky and difficult. At all costs avoid driving at commuter hours (morning or 3-6). Valet and front desk folks will make route suggestions. Starbucks closed on weekends. Unclear how to retrieve messages from room telephone. Breakfast room can be very crowded; to avoid this go early, and avoid late hours. Room refrigerator not easily set and was extremely cold; it froze fruit, water and flowers! Ample hot water but slow to run hot (3-4 minutes late at night; most hotels are instant-hot)

Reviews.Title: “Better than I'd expected!”
Reviews.Author: Westm0
Reviews.Content: Had a great few nights at the Marriott Springhill Suites. Was in town for some sightseeing with a friend who'd never been to Seattle before, and this hotel was a good "home base" despite it being a short walk away from the tourist core. Friendly and attentive staff, modern, trendy, aquatic look throughout the main floor, and the lounge/bar was well attended by people wining and dining. Taxis took forever to arrive each time we'd asked the front desk staff to call one for us. Later we realized it's because they have a contract with the orange cabs only! Call a yellow cab from your room, or insist the staff call them for you. I found they were faster to arrive than the orange company (maybe they have more cars?). Location was fine. We took Howell St (Olive turns into it if you're coming from downtown) to and from the hotel during the day and night. Never felt vulernable or nervous, the area is pretty quiet, just parkades and office buildings in the immediate neighbourhood. That being said, we found the nearby Habesha restaurant to be our favourite place of the trip! We'd never tried Eithiopian food before, and this place was fantastic. Classy, great staff, dim lighting, nice ambiance, and AMAZING FOOD. Highly recommend starting with the Selata (salad) and sharing the chicken and lamb entrees. The hotel's breakfast buffet significantly exceeded our expectations. I'd never been to a hotel where their waffles are any more than toaster eggos, frozen belgiums, or the like. Springhill Suites had a separate station set up with batter, hot waffle irons (with clear DIY instructions), strawberries (in syrup), cans of whipped cream, and syrup. The rest of the buffet was hot and standard, with cereals, scrambled eggs, sausages, home fries, condiments/hot sauces, oatmeal, baked goods (bagels, muffins, scones, cinnamon buns, bread, etc), fresh raw fruit (whole oranges and apples), individual yogurts, and juice. Lots of seating. The only place in seattle I've found that has free breakfast. Saved us a ton of money. What else...the room! We had a King Suite and found it fine. Nothing special, lots of space. We had a room right beside the freeway, request one away from here (if they have any?). No mirror in the bathroom/shower area. It's in the separate sink area. Good I guess if someone's having a shower, and someone else wants to get ready. Free internet was a plus! Follow the instructions on the desk. Overall, I'd stay here again. Will recommend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “It's fine if you're not fussy”
Reviews.Author: Uncle_Benny_from_BC
Reviews.Content: Went down for an overnight shopping trip. Pro's: 1) Very professional and friendly check in employees 2) Decent hot/cold breakfast as expected. 3) You get a guest pass to 24Hour Fitness located across the street. Nice bonus if you are a work out freak. I unfortunately didn't bring my Nikes :( Con's: 1) Really soft bed that squeeked...barely slept. 2) The carpet felt dingy. Highly recommended that you wear your shoes while in suite. 3) Bathroom faucet and bar faucet have incredibly low water pressure. 4) Sketchy area. We were lucky to find street parking across the street in front of 24Hour Fitness. Felt better that the gym is open 24hours. I would have paid for valet parking otherwise = $28. 5) Beware that this is not a quiet hotel. It's on a major street leading up to I-5. Lots of traffice in front of the hotel. 6) Crappy TV signal. The Residence Inn Lake Union offered HD channels (for comparison). 7) The bath curtain was cut short, I assume because the bottom was moldy and unsightly. It was so short that water from the shower created a mini-lake around the toilet. Not nice....

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: Galaxy775
Reviews.Content: It was a good value. We got a special promotion that got us a room including parking for under $100/night. For this kind of money it is difficult to complain. Overall, It is a decent hotel in an OK location. It's about 15-20 minutes walk to the heart of downtown. The hotel is next to the highway so noise could be a concern for a light sleeper. The room was well appointed and fairly clean. The bed linens and towels were very clean but towels looked and felt very used up: thin and rough. As with all SpringHill Suites, in-room internet and breakfast were included but beware of the breakfast. The selection is limited and very little of it is edible. Scrambled eggs tasted like latex, potatoes made you feel that you're chewing on the cotton balls. For your toast, only white bread was available. Also, during the five nights that we stayed, the hotel was fully packed with families with kids so you had to stay on long line and had difficult time getting the table unless you got there early. After the first morning, we opted to eat somewhere else. All in all, this hotel is a good option if you are on the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Little things make a big difference!”
Reviews.Author: imqz
Reviews.Content: Breakfast good. Room adequate. Shuttle poor- dodgy area to walk in. Don't count on it ! When it was full (repeatedly) they suggested a cab. Did not get a place with a shuttle so could pay for cab! Pool and hot tub filthy. Washer dryer worked well. Needed more cups towels and soap by the kitchen sink.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on outskirts of downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: davidbViennaVA
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 nite in early March. Hotel is fine -- clean room, great breakfast. It is right next to the I-5 so request a high floor to avoid road noise. Free internet access and a 24/7 fitness center across the street. Hotel is a healthy walk from downtown Seattle and people not used to walking in a strange city might not enjoy the walk. Its not unsafe but there are a few vacany lots and seedy looking streets.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, but...”
Reviews.Author: bwrightva
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel late at night and had no problem checking in. The room was clean, well-appointed and comfortable. Unfortunately, on the TV the volume only went up halfway, but I wasn't there to watch TV, so no biggie. The continental breakfast was exceptional and mighty welcome, but be sure to get down there early, because the lines can get long. Also, complimentary Seattle-Times and Wall Street Journal made my morning breakfast even more enjoyable. Regrettably, parking in the area is hard to come by, just about forcing a driving guest to use the hotel's valet parking ($20 a day). Many hotels in the area have cheaper parking, and I did feel like it was something of a rip off. But, all in all, it was a pretty good experience. I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, walking to most downtown destinations”
Reviews.Author: ChesterSF
Reviews.Content: Good: This location doesn't have great amenities, but it does have everything you would need. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I also like the fact it is right next to my gym (24-hr Fitness). The breakfast is included, so I was ready to head out in the morning. Shuttle service to nearby downtown locations is convenient when the rain pours down. This is the hotel I'd pick anytime in downtown Seattle. Bad: - It's right next to the highway, so it's a bit noisy. - The surrounding area isn't as yuppie as the heart of downtown, but it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no complaints. (That's a first.)”
Reviews.Author: Quaris
Reviews.Content: Location was decent for what I was in Seattle for, although 5 blocks closer to downtown shopping would have been nice. I asked for a quiet room as I am a light sleeper and I got exactly that. The decor could use a refresh, it's looking pretty 90's in the rooms with plaid chairs and green & beige wallpaper. But the bed was comfortable. Had a fridge. And FULL hot breakfast in the mornings in the lobby restaurant, included in the price. Staff was very accommodating to everything we asked for. Will stay again. Not sure about parking - we left the car up on Capitol Hill and walked down. Hotel is about 10 minute walk to downtown shopping, 15 minutes to Capitol Hill/Broadway, 15 to waterfront. And free pass to the fitness center across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: carynsdad
Reviews.Content: A friend & I went to Seattle for a long weekend & stayed at the Springhill Suites in Downtown Seattle. I always thought Springhill Suites was at the lower end of the Marriott hotel chain, but I was VERY pleasantly surprised to find a large suite that was clean & well appointed, (although a small sink area in the bathroom) and a staff that went above & beyond to make us feel welcome. They made arrangements for us for a city tour and an airport town car. The rate included a wonderful hot breakfast and a shuttle into the center of town and back to the hotel. I would not think twice bout staying at another Springhill Suites because of this excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: stuartSydney
Reviews.Content: Couldn't really fault this place - big rooms, great internet , helpful staff - very easy flat 10 minute walk to downtown. For the price it was very reasonable and i couldn't really fault anything. Would stay here again for sure. Breakfast was basic (plastic cutlery and crockery ) but great as included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “The price is what makes this place a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tcouncil
Reviews.Content: It is nice that the hotel is Downtown, but it is on the outskirts nestled right up against the freeway. One of the staff members was quite rude, which was unfortunate. We didn't spend much time at the hotel at all except to sleep. It has a nice little indoor pool and jacuzzi, and always has hot tea and coffee in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “They try hard, but it's still an OK hotel in a dicey neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Stara333
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SpringHill Suites when I traveled to Seattle to run the marathon. The hotel was recently renovated, so the lobby, bar & restaurant areas were pleasing to the eye. The rooms were nice as well, but they were definitely basic/bare bones. The free continental breakfast was great, but the food at the restaurant for lunch, dinner and room service was just mediocre. Worth it to eat there at the bar for reduced price bar snacks/light bites during happy hour, but would not recommend eating there otherwise for the price. That being said, it's at least a 10 minute walk to any other decent restaurant, so you may feel forced to dine there for the convenience. You can tell that they have tried hard to make this hotel better. The decor in the common areas was very pleasant/modern, and the space did seem quite clean/well-maintained. However, I felt that the management missed the mark on several key issues. Most obviously, they had NO idea whatsoever that there was a marathon in the city that weekend, and offered no service to the hundreds of runners that were staying at the hotel. It seems insane that they would not have known such a major event was taking place. The hotel typically runs a "convenience shuttle" to other nearby areas of the city (basically designed to prevent you from walking around the less-than-desirable neighborhood where it's located), but refused to run the shuttle once earlier in the morning on race day to get runners (who had to head to the race area before daybreak) to the race area. This seemed like a very major miss, and a sign of bigger things that were lacking as far as the management of the establishment. Overall, I will say that they tried hard, were willing to work with the guests, and very pleasant. But, I would definitely recommend staying closer to the more touristy areas of town and away from the run-down bus depot area where this hotel is located.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: MNtravelbugs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Seattle in the beginning of September over Labor Day weekend with our 5 year old daughter and 4 month old son. It was his first ever trip and it was great! The room was spacious and accommodated the 4 of us and all our gear. I wouldn't call it a real "suite", though, since there was no wall dividing the bedroom area and the living area, just a quarter-wall, but it worked for us since we wanted our daughter sleeping close by. Breakfast was great in the morning. The location wasn't bad, close to all the major attractions. They did have a shuttle that brought guests to some of the attractions but unfortunately it brought us to the Space Needle and didn't pick us up! We had booked the shuttle back but the driver had apparently forgotten about us. We waited for about 45 minutes and called the hotel, who paid for us to get a cab ride back. Other than this it was a great place to stay at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nachosmom1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Seattle in August at the SpringHill Suites and were pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was. The breakfast was awesome - hot and cold and there was lots of seating. I was really impressed with the rooms - large and clean. My only complaint is that the hotel, being alittle further from Pike Place, etc., only had the shuttle go 3/4 way downtown, so you were left to walk fairly far if you wanted to go down to the waterfront, etc. You also have to pay the valet $20/night for parking, but they were really fast and efficient in retrieving your vehicle. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we would not hesitate to return. The only reason we wouldn't, is so we could be closer to downtown (or would stay in a different hotel that had a shuttle that went down to the waterfront).

Reviews.Title: “Great Seattle Value”
Reviews.Author: MileHiDenver
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in the Springfield Suites prior to and after our Alaska cruise. The hotel is in great condition and within walking distance (about a mile) of the waterfront and Pike Place Market. The room works well for a family with college-age children and the buffet breakfast is certainly a money saver. We were extremely grateful that the hotel allows early check-in since most cruise ships return to Seattle in the early morning. I would recommend this hotel for family stays in downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kentucky1937
Reviews.Content: Although not downtown, their shuttle makes it easy to get there. The hotel itself is very clean and comfortable. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. This reflects the leadership of the manager, Louis Haslett, who is very people oriented. The property borders I-5, but noise is no more than you would expect from any hotel located in a busy city. This is our second Spring Hill stay in the last few months. Both were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: northernstar30
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here for a weekend. Parking was about $20 per night. The hotel itself seemed nice and clean, staff were friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and the bed was comfy. We overlooked I-5 so not a great view, but we didn't spend much time in the hotel room. The hotel was a little out of the way, but saying that we walked everywhere. There is a courtesy shuttle bus provided by the hotel which takes you to various places, but you have to book a place on it well in advance. The receptionist was very helpful and told us where to get the ublic transport bus, what bus to catch etc to get downtown. The bus stop is only around the corner from the hotel, and public transport is cheap enough. We walked back from the space needle and it took us 30 mins at a moderate pace. The thing that I found most disappointing about the hotel was the breakfast. There was a good choice of food available, but probably the worst breakfast ever. It was either cold, rubbery, or swimming in grease depending on what you ate. We skipped breakfast the second morning and ate out.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay-get a room facing north”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times and never been disappointed. Not in the downtown core (about a half mile away) but closer to Capitol Hill. Booked at seattlesupersaver.com (and got a better rate than on Marriott.com, even with AAA). Got my favorite room (facing north). Some rooms are too close to I-5 or city streets. Room was spotless. Service was great. FREE use of the 24 Hour Fitness across the street. Nice breakfast. Alot of families here. I'm a picky traveller but can't find anything to criticize with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: askirsh
Reviews.Content: I perused TripAdvisor for weeks before choosing Springhill Suites in Seattle. Here are my issues: * We booked a King Suite. It is listed as a two room suite. To me, two rooms means that the rooms are separate. This is not the case. There is a giant doorway between the bedroom and the living room. There is just one television on a small dresser in this doorway and it turns towards the bed or towards the couch. I booked this room because my husband always wakes up before me and likes to watch TV without disturbing me. Not this time. * The area around the hotel is not a nice part of the city. We did not feel comfortable walking around. We were very far from the tourist attractions; not walking distance at all. This is a big concern for me. Here are my praises: * The ladies at the front desk are very friendly yet professional. We felt welcomed. In fact, all the staff members we encountered were very courteous. * There is a free shuttle from 7 am to 9 pm, every hour on the hour, that takes guests to The Convention Center, Space Needle, or Pike Place Market. * Free in-room WiFi internet...always nice. * Great view of the Space Needle from our room. * Free breakfast. Other info: * Parking is $20. I like free parking better, but so be it. * There is a mini-fridge and microwave in the room. * There is a small indoor pool and a jacuzzi. * The exercise room consists of two treadmills and one elliptical machine. * There is a business center with a computer and printer. We would not stay at this hotel again only because of the room configuration and the distance to the attractions that brought us here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel LOVED it!!”
Reviews.Author: SouthMauiGuy
Reviews.Content: I just read the trip report of the people who satyed over the same weekend we did (4th July 2009 weekend) Everyone in our party of 6 loved this hotel. Here is a mini summery of our stay. mini trip report about the hotel. First off whoever said they wouldnt recommend this hotel was just a bit off in my opinion. We had a great time at this hotel. The only charge per night is a 20 dollar a night parking charge...no biggie.(its a BIg city and Ive seen 60 dollar a night charges before) We got 2 rooms thru Priceline for 65 each, 3 nights amenities incuded an indoor pool and hot tub, free wireless or free computer use and printers in their business center FREE buffet breakfast each morning (GOOD) good selection of Fresh and Buffet foods eggs sausage bisquits yogurts breads cereal orange apple juice milk coffee etc The lobby was just recently remodeled and it looks like a 4* quality lobby. VERY Impressive remodel!! Every employee was as nice as can be and very professional, On sundays they have an appetizer promotion (2.50) and they were GREAT KOBE beef sliders/Chix Skewers Poke,,,,,pan asian spicy noodles... everything was GREAT. The rooms are basic but nice enough and large. Its listed as a 2.5* hotel but really is a 3.5* hotel. Its and incredible deal We even got a Space Needle View from our rooms. I would Highly Recommend this Fine Mariott Property!

Reviews.Title: “good value, but lacking a little in some areas”
Reviews.Author: danzimbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the 4th July weekend, so the hotel was busy. Check-in was easy and friendly enough. I had a room facing the highway, which was a bit noisy, but the glazing cushioned it quite well. The room was a generous size, with amenties to aid in self catering if you prefer. However, although the bath tub has a "non-slip" surface for taking a shower, it is still lethally slippery in my opinion. On calling down for a non-slip mat, I was told there were non left as they had all been 'lent' out to other guests...The bathroom and basin areas are seperate which is quite a good idea, but the bath soap and shampoo are left by the basin for some strange reason, meaning if you forget them, you need to take a slippery wet walk out to fetch them????? On the occasions we needed something, the staff seemed not be as responsive or receptive to the enquiry as one would like, but there was one lady (from UTAH according to her badge) who seemed to be the best of the bunch for me. Like I said it was 4th Jul weekend, so breakfast was extra busy. Nevertheless I was a little disappointed by the selection, which seemed to be limited somewhat. they ran out of waffle mix early on, and they couldn't bus the tables quickly enough. Also, I did 'catch' some of the staff exiting the kitchen actively chewing on something, which was very unprofessional. We had a late flight, meaning that we had to check-out whilst they secured our bags for the afternoon. On our return, we enquired about if there somewhere we could freshen up, and the staff recommended the Gym across the street, which hosts guests of the hotel free of charge. However, when we asked about towels, we were told the gym SOLD towels. There was no effort by the staff to get a couple of their towels for us to use, and it was only on our suggestion that there may be some in the hotel pool area, that they though it was a logical idea. Even so, they expected us to go and get them although i felt they should have tried to do all they could to aid us. As a Marriot Silver Elite member, I expected more from the staff servicewise and this was the most disappointing thing. Starbucks/Subway across the street shut on weekends. Long walk from downtown area, hence one reason I wouldnt choose here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: leazel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and 2 boys (7 & 10). Our room was clean and overlooked the street. The hotel is right next to the freeway, I was not bothered by the freeway noise but, my husband was somewhat. If your a light sleeper I suggest requesting a room on the west end. that may help. There are limited resteraunts in the area, a subway across the street, pizza delivery and room service, the menu had a seafood/mexican flare and I thought it was resonably priced. But, there are more resteraunts within walking distance. And I thought it was no big deal, and we generally ate while sightseeing anyhow. The hotel provides a free shuttel on the hour that takes you to the Space needle area. and from there one could take many of the free transit buses to get to other places. Our kids liked the pool although it was majorly clorinated. There's a shower in the pool area, I suggest using it. FYI, the hot tub is blazing hot! The breakfast buffet was very good w/eggs, sausage, cereal, fruit, pastrys, and a waffle station. I thought it was great concidering it's free. The staff was very nice and when we decided to stay an extra night they gave it at the price we paied the previous nights. We payed 99.00 for the first night and 109.00 for the two other nights. A great deal that I booked though the Seattle Visitors bearu website. All in all, we were vey pleased with our stay expecially at the rate we got. Hope this was somewhat helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations.”
Reviews.Author: NIrelandGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights pre-cruise. It was an excellent hotel maybe 15-20mins walk to the town if you did not use the shuttle .All the staff were very helpful and very pleasant . do not be afraid to use this hotel it is much more than a 2-3 star save your money for the sights and sounds of this beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - no car needed from here...”
Reviews.Author: cbmertz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely newer for being so close to Seattle Center and downtown. Service and personnel were all excellent. Had heard of issues being so close to I-5, but did not have any distrubances from traffic. A short walk to the market or waterfront and complimentary shuttle service to Seattle Center is very convienent. The room was spacious, clean and well-appointed. Definitely will stay here again whether it is for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: bluelightning
Reviews.Content: The room was large, quiet and clean. The breakfast had a large selection of items. The food consisted of good, basic breakfast items: eggs, cereals, fruit, yogurt, sausage, eggs, muffins, etc. It was an easy walk to the Convention Center and a free shuttle went there as well, although only once/hour. My only complaint was about lost and found run by housekeeping. After checking out, I thought that I had left something in my room. I called twice. leaving voice mail messages with housekeeping. My calls were never returned.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Realaloha
Reviews.Content: Great location off of I5. Hotel room was clean and spacious. Got in late and enjoyed a drink and appetizers at the well stocked bar. Food was delicious and fresh. Breakfast offered a large selection of bread items plus scrambled eggs, bagon, sausage and potatoes. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. Valet parking only. Starbucks across the street is closed on the weekends. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: FrozenSox
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel in the past and enjoyed it, but not this last time. Room overlooked the alley and garbage cans. Be sure to request a corner room if you can. Remodel in the lobby turned it from cozy & conversational to cold and museum-like. The furniture is really spread out making it difficult to have an intimate or quiet conversation with someone without shouting or moving the furniture. If you're thinking about room service you'd better really like spicy asian cuisine because that's all they offer. Not real crazy about the $20/day mandatory valet parking, and certainly wasn't happy when items were missing from my vehicle. However, the breakfast is fantastic! But at $150 a night (including valet), Seattle offers many other hotels that have better locations, views, food options and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: chiggy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the hotel for a night. We booked a room from a website of Seattle Supersaver (https://www.seattlesupersaver.com/) and the room was only $89 a night with full breakfast, which was pretty good. The room was well-appointed and clean. Our room was facing the highway, but was still quiet. The exercise room was going under the reno. but it did not bother us. My husband liked it so much that we wanted to extend our stay, but could not get the same rate directly with the hotel. For the price of $89 it was a bargain, but for extra $50 on top of that, we decided not to stay an extra night. Overall, we were happy with the stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelnut808
Reviews.Content: Nice room, actually a large one room with enough room for two full size beds and a pull-out sofa and kitchenette. Our room was quiet, could not hear the freeway noise. Restaurants not close by but walkable distance.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed by Springhill Suites”
Reviews.Author: ams
Reviews.Content: My sister & I sepnt 2 nights here and were impressed by the hotel. Upon arrival in the morning, we were offered a free breakfast while the friendly desk clerk checked to see whether any rooms were immediately available for us. No room was free so early, so our bags were stored while we left to expore the city. While not right downtown, the hotel is an easy 5-10 minutes walk from many locations in the city. It's exceptionally close to the huge REI flagship store and a few minutes' walk (up/downhill) from a Whole Foods packed with delicious supper options should you prefer to 'eat in'. The 'suite' we had was quite small and the beds were fairly wedged in, but this allowed us to have a small sofa as well as a desk and kitchen area - all facilities we appreciated having. The selection at the free breakfast buffet was impressive and the dining area was nicely set out with plenty of space to enjoy your meal. Overall, we were impressed with our stay at the Springhill Suites - it provided an excellent base from which to explore the city and the facilities included meade it excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ive stayed in in a long time”
Reviews.Author: Adam1222
Reviews.Content: Wow, some people on here clearly never travel. Oh my god- a urban hotel only has valet parking, and they charge $20 for it! The room isn't as palacial as my exurban mcmansion bedroom! What is this "double bed"? <GASP> There isn't a cheesecake factory across the street! But seriously folks, this hotel is phenomenal. Even as a priceline guest ($70!), they gave me early checkin at 9:30am, though I only asked if i could check my bag in come back. The rooms are quite comfortable, and standard size. Housekeeping keeps the rooms and all common areas immaculate. Free bottle of water in the room, and free wifi. Free Wall st Journal and Seattle Times Intelligencer in the lobby, free USA Today to your door, free coffee 24 hrs/day, and the nicest free breakfast Ive ever seen at a hotel. Make your own belgian waffles, potatoes, eggs, bacon, pastries, bagels, cereals, juices. My only complaint is the breakfast room is a little small, so I chose to take my food up to my room and eat at the couch and coffee table rather than share a table with strangers. Didnt eat at the restaurant onsite, but the prices looked very reasonable, as did the happy hour bar. There is a subway restuarant and starbucks across the street, and an italian fast food place. Smoothie place and minimart around the corner, and ethiopian and american restaurants within 5 blocks. But ALL of downtown Seattle is within a 20 minute walk. Theres a whole foods market and complex of restaurants about 5 minutes away. Pike Place, which is on the complete other end of the city is about 20 minutes away. Belltown, Capitol Hill bars, etc, all 20 minutes or less. This location is phenomenal. No safety concerns at all. The area is "up and coming" with a lot of lofts etc being built. But it wasnt a bad neighborhood before, just a mostly commercial/industrial. Finally, in addition to a fine fitness center onsite, complimentary access to a HUGE AMAZING 24-hr fitness directly across the street. All you do is show your ID, hotel key, and sign a waiver. wow. great. Bottom line: great location, great amenities, great value. If you are the Princess and the Pea, or aren't familiar with how to navigate cities more than 3 blocks in size, then maybe not for you.

Reviews.Title: “never again until they change the bedding”
Reviews.Author: thebigsub
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of september for one night,sheets and pillow cases worn to bits, and creased like one star. Complained to the management, and the car parking was taken off my bill. Very dissapointed with thebedding standard for $240 with tax Never again,.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: traveler50123
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on the Seattle Supersaver for 3 nights at the beginning of September, 2008. It proved to be an excellent choice. The hotel is modern and clean with a nice lobby and bar. The indoor swimming pool and whirlpool were great. The towels were provided, the water in the whirlpool was at just right temperature. There was a computer room on the ground floor with free internet access, two computers and a printer. Access provided with the room â€œkeyâ€� (electronic card). All free of charge. The check-in and out was a breeze. The room was decent size with king size bed, living area with sofa, and a kitchenette. Everything worked fine. We did not use kitchenette. Excellent buffet breakfast was provided, and we did not feel like cooking dinners there. Fridge came handy though to store some drinks. It is true that there are no restaurants nearby, but a walk to downtown takes only about 20 minutes, and the selection there is very good. There was also free coffee in the lobby 24h a day, usually of quite decent quality and relatively fresh. Starbucks is across the street for more sophisticated brew. The area around hotel is not particularly pleasant and some may feel a bit uneasy in the evening. A lot better though than other areas in Seattle, for example around Pioneer Square. The Highway 5 is just outside the hotel. It is a bit noisy, but did not bother us, even that our room was on the highway side. Hotel charges extra for parking, but we did not have a car so we did not care. There is a free shuttle to downtown, but only every hour, and by reservation. We did not use this service.
